issues.title: EdDSA implementation in PLUGIN_NAME exhibits signature malleability
issues.description_adoc:
PLUGIN_NAME makes the EdDSA-Java library (`ed25519-java`) available to other plugins.

PLUGIN_NAME 0.3.0-13.v7cb_69ed68f00 and earlier bundles version 0.3.0 of EdDSA-Java, which exhibits signature malleability and does not satisfy the SUF-CMA (Strong Existential Unforgeability under Chosen Message Attacks) property.
This allows attackers to create new valid signatures different from previous signatures for a known message.

PLUGIN_NAME 0.3.0.1-16.vcb_4a_98a_3531c inlines the EdDSA-Java library (`ed25519-java`) directly into the plugin and adds validation to prevent signature malleability and ensure the SUF-CMA property.
issues.description_html:
EDDSA API Plugin makes the EdDSA-Java library (ed25519-java) available to other plugins.

EDDSA API Plugin 0.3.0-13.v7cb_69ed68f00 and earlier bundles version 0.3.0 of EdDSA-Java, which exhibits signature malleability and does not satisfy the SUF-CMA (Strong Existential Unforgeability under Chosen Message Attacks) property. This allows attackers to create new valid signatures different from previous signatures for a known message.

EDDSA API Plugin 0.3.0.1-16.vcb_4a_98a_3531c inlines the EdDSA-Java library (ed25519-java) directly into the plugin and adds validation to prevent signature malleability and ensure the SUF-CMA property.

issues.title: Stored XSS vulnerability in PLUGIN_NAME
issues.description_adoc:
PLUGIN_NAME 1.0 does not limit URL schemes for links it creates based on workspace content, allowing the `javascript:` scheme.

This results in a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exploitable by attackers able to control the input file for the Anchor Chain post-build step.

As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix.
link:/security/plugins/#unresolved[Learn why we announce this.]
issues.description_html:
AnchorChain Plugin 1.0 does not limit URL schemes for links it creates based on workspace content, allowing the javascript: scheme.

This results in a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exploitable by attackers able to control the input file for the Anchor Chain post-build step.

As of publication of this advisory, there is no fix. Learn why we announce this.

issues.reporter: Romuald Moisan, Aix Marseille University, and Said Abdesslem Messadi, Aix Marseille University
issues.title: API key displayed without masking by PLUGIN_NAME
issues.description_adoc:
PLUGIN_NAME stores the QEngine API Key in job `config.xml` files on the Jenkins controller as part of its configuration.

While this key is stored encrypted on disk, in PLUGIN_NAME 1.0.29.vfa_cc23396502 and earlier the job configuration form does not mask the QEngine API Key form field, increasing the potential for attackers to observe and capture it.

PLUGIN_NAME 1.0.31.v4a_b_1db_6d6a_f2 masks the QEngine API Key form field.
issues.description_html:
Zoho QEngine Plugin stores the QEngine API Key in job config.xml files on the Jenkins controller as part of its configuration.

While this key is stored encrypted on disk, in Zoho QEngine Plugin 1.0.29.vfa_cc23396502 and earlier the job configuration form does not mask the QEngine API Key form field, increasing the potential for attackers to observe and capture it.

Zoho QEngine Plugin 1.0.31.v4a_b_1db_6d6a_f2 masks the QEngine API Key form field.
